text:
software:
  web server - tomcat 3.2.1 running on win2k sp1 with latest hot fixes.  it is 
running as an out of process container.  IIS (version that come with win2k) is 
filtering pages over to tomcat by way of the isapi_redirect.dll (most recent 
version)
  firewall - raptor firewall 6.5 running on winnt 4.0 sp 6a.  
  web client - ie 5.5 running on win98.

setup:  
  tomcat lives behind the raptor firewall.  the firewall has one outside ip 
address.  it allows requests to the outside address, port 80 in and redirects 
them to the ip address of tomcat's host, port 80.  the client machine lives on 
the outside of the firewall and access the web server and tomcat by pointing his 
web browser to the outside address of the firewall.

work flow:  
  on the server side i have login.jsp that has an html form in it that gets a 
user name and password.  the action for the form is loginprocess.jsp.  in 
loginprocess.jsp the username and password are checked and the user is 
redirected (using response.sendRedirect("input.jsp"))over to his page 
(input.jsp).

issue: 
  when a web client is using ie 5.5, and puts in his user name and password, the 
first time through, it works by bring up input.jsp.  if the user pushes the back 
button and tries to login again, it fails to bring up input.jsp.  instead the 
browser just sits there and waits for the page to load, which it never does.  if 
the user goes to home.html by way of clicking on a link (as opposed to using the 
back button again, which i have not tried) and then clicks to the login page, 
and tries to login again, it works by bringing up input.jsp.  the firewall 
provides a small clue in its logs.  sometimes it will have an error associated 
with the failure that says in it "200 -- HTTP/0.9" and "(Unexpected client 
close)".  the raptor people say that this indicates that something is using HTTP 
version 0.9 and they can't help me with that since their firewall is proxy 
based and the proxy only works with HTTP/1.0 and HTTP/1.1.  this problem does 
not arise with any netscape version or ie 4.0.  it also is not a problem with ie 
5.5 when it connects directly to the web server (not through the firewall).  

now this would all sound like an ie 5.5 problem and in some ways i guess that it 
is, except that talking to microsoft is impossible about such things....and 
besides, i was able to work around the problem programmatically.  i changed out 
the response.sendRedirect("input.jsp") with <jsp:forward page="input.jsp"/> in 
loginprocess.jsp.  

i am sending this bug report for a few reasons.....
1)  i don't know exactly what the interaction was to that made this happen 
(perhaps the tomcat implementation has something to do with it, although i doubt 
it)
2)  this was very confusing to me and it held me up for days.  i would love for 
this work around to appear somewhere that others can access it so that they can 
quickly resolve the problem.  

you can feel free to contact me for clarification.  i hope that this was a good 
bug posting (my first).
creator: adam@dmscomp.com
